macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Indexes Show Mixed Performance; Defense Stocks Rally on Trump Defense Spending Plans
items.summary: On Thursday, the S&P 500 rose less than 0.1%, the Dow gained 0.6%, and the Nasdaq fell 0.4%. Defense contractors including Northrop Grumman, Lockheed Martin, and L3Harris Technologies led gains after President Trump announced plans to increase U.S. defense spending sharply.

items.title: Energy and Industrial Stocks Drive Market as Oil Rallies on Iran Supply Concerns
items.summary: Energy stocks and industrials led market performance Thursday amid sharp oil rallies following reports of strikes on Iranian pipelines and gas shortages, raising concerns about potential supply shocks from the sanctioned nation.

items.title: Markets Await Major Jobs Data; US Dollar Strengthens on Economic Optimism
items.summary: Traders remained cautious ahead of Friday's simultaneous U.S. and Canadian labor reports, with the U.S. releasing full payrolls data alongside wages and participation metrics. The U.S. dollar strengthened against all major currency peers on upbeat layoffs data.

items.title: Alphabet Overtakes Apple in Market Capitalization
items.summary: Alphabet surpassed Apple in market capitalization on Thursday, with Apple slipping during the session.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin holds above $90,000 as total crypto market cap tops $3 trillion
items.summary: Bitcoin is trading steadily above $90,000 while the overall crypto market capitalization has surpassed $3 trillion, rising about 5% in the first week of January and signaling strong risk-on sentiment across digital assets.[1][4]

items.title: Ethereum 'Fusaka' upgrade boosts throughput and underpins 10% price rise YTD
items.summary: Ethereum developers successfully activated the 'Fusaka' (BPO-2) upgrade on January 7, increasing blob data limits per block to improve scalability and lower fees, while ETH trades around $3,200, up roughly 10% since the start of the year.[1]

items.title: Altcoins outpace Bitcoin as XRP jumps over 25% in early 2026
items.summary: Several major altcoins are outperforming Bitcoin, with XRP up more than 25% and Ethereum up about 10% since the beginning of the year, reflecting renewed investor appetite for higher-risk crypto assets.[1]

items.title: Binance market update: BTC trades near $90,400 as majors see mixed performance
items.summary: A Binance market snapshot shows Bitcoin around $90,399, up 0.4% on the day, with large-cap cryptocurrencies posting mixed movements and a handful of tokens emerging as notable outperformers in intraday trading.[4]

items.title: U.S. may expand Bitcoin holdings into strategic reserve, says Cathie Wood
items.summary: ARK Invest CEO Cathie Wood said she expects U.S. federal policy could evolve from only holding seized bitcoin to actively purchasing BTC for a national strategic reserve, as Trump’s second-term agenda ties crypto policy to upcoming 2026 midterm politics.[3]

items.title: Trump administration formalizes U.S. Bitcoin reserve and broader crypto stockpile
items.summary: An executive order early in Trump’s second term created a U.S. bitcoin reserve and wider digital asset stockpile, administered by the Treasury Department and initially funded with forfeited assets, alongside recommendations to give the CFTC authority over spot markets in non-security digital assets.[3]

items.title: Major large-cap altcoins flirt with record highs amid institutional demand
items.summary: BNB is trading near $900, close to its historical maximum, while Solana around $135 continues its recovery on strong network performance and investor attention, with an SOL ETF launch reportedly anticipated by market participants.[1]

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: MIT–Microsoft team uses AI-designed peptide sensors for earlier cancer detection
items.summary: Researchers from MIT and Microsoft developed an AI model that designs peptide-based molecular sensors targeted by cancer-associated proteases, enabling blood or urine tests that could detect tumors at much earlier stages than current methods.

items.title: Mobileye to acquire humanoid robotics startup Mentee Robotics for $900 million
items.summary: Mobileye agreed to acquire humanoid robot maker Mentee Robotics for $900 million, signaling an expansion from autonomous driving into broader "physical AI" by combining Mobileye’s perception and planning stack with Mentee’s vertically integrated humanoid platforms.

items.title: EngineAI unveils T800 full-scale humanoid robot and PM01 lightweight agent at CES
items.summary: EngineAI Robotics Technology showcased its T800 humanoid robot and PM01 general-purpose embodied agent at CES, emphasizing application-ready physical AI with full-body coordination and fine motor control aimed at real-world industrial and service deployments.

items.title: Hexagon Robotics partners with Microsoft to build production-ready humanoid robots for factories
items.summary: Hexagon Robotics announced a strategic partnership with Microsoft to develop humanoid systems for data-driven manufacturing, combining Hexagon’s robotics and sensor fusion with Azure-based cloud and edge AI, including multimodal vision-language-action models for manipulation and inspection tasks.

items.title: AMD launches Ryzen AI Embedded processors with integrated NPUs for edge inference
items.summary: AMD introduced its Ryzen AI Embedded processor portfolio, bringing integrated neural processing units and Ryzen-class CPUs to industrial PCs, robotics, and smart cameras, targeting efficient on-device AI inference with extended temperature and lifecycle support for OEMs.

items.title: Lenovo debuts new ThinkSystem inference servers for real-time enterprise AI workloads
items.summary: Lenovo announced new ThinkSystem servers optimized for low-latency, high-throughput AI inference, designed to serve production models for use cases such as fraud detection, recommendations, and conversational AI in hybrid enterprise environments.

items.title: NIST funds two AI Economic Security Centers for manufacturing and critical infrastructure
items.summary: The U.S. National Institute of Standards and Technology is investing $20 million to establish two AI centers focused on boosting manufacturing productivity and strengthening cybersecurity for critical infrastructure by developing evaluated AI agents that reduce reliance on insecure AI systems.

items.title: UF analysis shows rapid growth and gaps in AI-driven cancer clinical trials
items.summary: University of Florida researchers reviewed a decade of cancer clinical trials using AI and found machine learning dominates and most work targets detection, but many trials lack reported results or links to publications, limiting understanding of real-world clinical impact.

items.title: MIT expert outlines how AI could help optimize power grids amid rising data center demand
items.summary: MIT’s Priya Donti described emerging machine learning methods that embed physical grid constraints to optimize power system operations, aiming to improve efficiency, resilience to extreme weather, and renewable integration as AI-related electricity use surges.

items.title: Enterprise and healthcare leaders forecast shift to domain-specific, multi-agent genAI in 2026
items.summary: New commentary from SAP and CIO.com argues that generative AI in enterprises, especially healthcare, is moving away from monolithic general-purpose LLMs toward modular, domain-specific, and multi-agent architectures that are easier to govern, cheaper to run, and better aligned with regulated use cases.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: BioWare’s Anthem to become unplayable as EA shuts down servers on January 12
items.summary: Electronic Arts is permanently shutting down servers for BioWare’s 2019 online shooter Anthem on January 12, 2026, which will render the game completely unplayable and has reignited debate over game preservation and the Stop Killing Games campaign.

items.title: GameStop to close more stores as shift to digital gaming pressures retailer
items.summary: GameStop, which already shuttered 590 locations in fiscal 2024, plans a “significant number” of additional store closures in its 2025 fiscal year ending January 2026, underscoring how digital downloads and online competition continue to erode its brick‑and‑mortar business.

items.title: Warner Bros. Games cuts jobs at San Francisco Digital Publishing division
items.summary: Warner Bros. Games has eliminated a number of roles at its San Francisco studio, which houses the company’s Digital Publishing division, marking another round of layoffs as the broader games industry continues to face restructuring and cost‑cutting.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: CES 2026 Showcases Bendable Screens, Smart Lego Sets, and Physical Keyboards
items.summary: CES 2026 featured major tech innovations including paper-thin TVs, Lego Smart Play with Star Wars integration using sensor-equipped smart bricks, and Clicks Technology's magnetic QWERTY keyboard that clips onto phones.

items.title: Razer Unveils Project Motoko Smart Headphones at CES 2026
items.summary: Gaming tech company Razer introduced Project Motoko, over-ear headphones with AI capabilities that can replicate smart glasses functionality, including real-time translation and information search.

items.title: Uber Reveals Robotaxi Developed with Lucid Motors and Nuro
items.summary: Uber unveiled its upcoming self-driving vehicle at CES 2026, developed in partnership with luxury EV maker Lucid Motors and autonomous technology company Nuro.

items.title: Fermilab Completes Construction of World's Largest Vertical Atom Interferometer
items.summary: Fermilab completed construction of a laser laboratory housing the world's largest vertical atom interferometer in Kane County, Illinois.
